newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold volume jumps on arbitrage deals.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold volume jumps on arbitrage deals.

text.p: Istanbul gold exchange volume continued to increase on Friday and jumped to 2,330 kilos from Thursday's 1,301 on banks' arbitrage trading, bankers said.
Gold closed firmer at $346.90 an ounce and 1,573,500 lira per gram, up from $346.00 and 1,562,400 lira Thursday, following rises in the international markets.
"There was not physical demand in the market. Almost all trading was based on the arbitrage deals," said one banker.
The Turkish lira eased to 140,410 against the dollar, from 140,300 Thursday close.
Most of the day's trade took place in the morning session with 55 percent of trade conducted in dollar terms.
